title: Stocks decline as yields remain elevated - Reuters
summary:
Stocks Decline as Yields Remain Elevated

Date & Source: December 30, 2024, Reuters

Introduction: Global stocks fell for a third straight session on Monday, with Wall Street tumbling, as recent elevated U.S. Treasury yields prompted profit taking at the end of a strong year for equities.

  1. U.S., European stocks fall
  2. Dollar up broadly but weaker vs yen
  3. 10-year U.S. Treasury yield falls but holds above 4.5%
The benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury yield's recent push above the 4.5% mark... will be a strong headwind for equity prices.

Conclusion: Stock markets in several countries were closed or had abbreviated trading sessions ahead of the New Year holiday.
newTitle: Stock Market Plunge as Treasury Yields Remain Elevated

title: ‘Boss Called Me A**hole’: Intern, 21, Opens Up About Toxic Workplace In India - News18
summary:
Intern Reveals Toxic Work Environment After Being Insulted by Boss in India

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: News18

A 21-year-old intern shared his distressing experience of workplace bullying on Reddit, revealing how his boss verbally assaulted him over a minor mistake in his work.

  • The intern was called an “a**hole” by his boss over a simple error in a draft.
  • He expressed his concerns on Reddit, seeking advice on whether to report the issue.
  • This incident highlights the toxic work culture present in some corporate environments in India.
  • The intern worried about possible repercussions of escalating the issue.
  • Reddit users encouraged him to address the situation and not remain silent.
“To say I was shocked would be an understatement. I’m genuinely frustrated and this isn’t the first time.”

This unfortunate incident raises awareness about bullying and the need for healthier workplace environments.
newTitle: Intern Reveals Toxic Work Environment After Being Insulted by Boss in India

title: Gold prices dip as markets await fresh catalysts - Reuters.com
Private Banks Grapple With 25% Attrition Rate, Operational Risks Loom: RBI - News18
summary:
Private Banks Face 25% Employee Attrition Amid Operational Risks, Says RBI

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: News18

The Reserve Bank of India's latest report highlights a troubling rise in employee attrition rates within private sector banks, which have reached approximately 25%. This poses serious operational risks for these financial institutions.

  • Employee attrition in private banks has increased to about 25%.
  • This trend brings significant operational risks related to customer service and loss of institutional knowledge.
  • The report indicates that the total count of employees in private banks has eclipsed that of public sector banks.
  • Strategies recommended to reduce turnover include better onboarding, career development, and supportive workplace cultures.
  • The RBI urged banks to review their gold loan policies due to observed irregularities.
  • Climate change risks are projected to negatively influence the financial stability of institutions.
“High attrition and employee turnover rate pose significant operational risks, including disruption in customer services, besides leading to loss of institutional knowledge and increased recruitment costs.” - RBI Report

This rising attrition rate signifies a critical challenge for private banks that requires immediate and effective strategic responses to safeguard operational efficiency and ensure long-term stability.
newTitle: Private Banks Face 25% Employee Attrition Amid Operational Risks, Says RBI

title: Wall St hits 1-week low in thin trading, elevated yields add pressure - Reuters
3 Types Of Bank Accounts To Be Closed From January 1: Is Yours One Of Them? - News18
summary:
3 Types Of Bank Accounts To Be Closed From January 1: Is Yours One Of Them?

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: News18

Starting January 1, 2025, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will implement rule changes affecting numerous bank accounts across the country. It is crucial for customers to understand these changes and how they may impact their accounts.

  • Dormant accounts (inactive for over two years) will be closed.
  • Inactive accounts (no transaction for 12 months or more) will also face closure.
  • Zero balance accounts maintained for an extended period risk being closed.
“To safeguard customers and the banking system, the RBI has decided to close such accounts.”

Customers must take immediate action to reactivate dormant accounts by completing necessary KYC processes.
newTitle: 3 Types Of Bank Accounts To Be Closed From January 1: Is Yours One Of Them?

title: SNAPSHOT Wall St opens lower on pressure from elevated Treasury yields - Reuters
summary:
Wall Street Opens Lower Amid Rising Treasury Yields

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: Reuters

The U.S. main stock indexes opened lower as the impact of rising Treasury yields influenced market trading.

  • The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 128.3 points, or 0.30%, to 42,863.86.
  • The S&P 500 decreased by 50.2 points, or 0.84%, to 5,920.67.
  • The Nasdaq Composite dropped 261.6 points, or 1.33%, to 19,460.413.
  • Sparse trading volumes contributed to the downward pressure.
The traditionally strong year-end rally for equities is under threat from the specter of rising Treasury yields.

This opening dip reflects market apprehensions ahead of the New Year.

title: GG Story of the Year 2024: Telegram Tap-to-Earn Gaming Explodes, Then Implodes - Decrypt
summary:
GG Story of the Year 2024: Telegram Tap-to-Earn Gaming Explodes, Then Implodes

Publication Date: 2024

Source: Decrypt

At the start of 2024, Telegram tap-to-earn games emerged as a unique trend, drawing millions of players. However, by the end of the year, the initial excitement quickly faded as players became disillusioned with disappointing rewards and game complications.

  • The tap-to-earn game Notcoin attracted over 35 million players shortly after its launch.
  • Hamster Kombat saw a rapid rise to 300 million players but faced backlash after its airdrop led to many receiving minimal benefits.
  • Despite initial success, players became frustrated with complicated token launches and unmet expectations.
  • Experts have mixed opinions on the future of tap-to-earn games, questioning their sustainability and engagement levels.
“Is the next Notcoin just around the corner in 2025? Perhaps.”

The year showcased the volatility of the gaming cryptocurrency landscape, leaving players and developers reconsidering the future of tap-to-earn models.
newTitle: Telegram Tap-to-Earn Gaming: A Year of Boom and Bust

title: Shriram Properties sells mall land in Chennai for ₹93 crore - BusinessLine
summary:
Shriram Properties sells mall land in Chennai for ₹93 crore

Updated - December 30, 2024 | Source: The Hindu Business Line

Shriram Properties Limited has sold a 3.9 acre land parcel in Chennai for ₹93 crore to a large healthcare and educational group. The sale is part of the company’s strategy to unlock value from non-core assets and focus on residential development.

  • Shriram Properties sold 3.9 acres of land in Chennai.
  • The sale amount is ₹93 crore.
  • The land is approved for development of retail space.
  • The decision aligns with SPL's focus on residential real estate.
  • CEO M Murali commented on the transaction as a significant step for the company's growth funding needs.
“This transaction marks a significant step in the Company’s plan to unlock value from existing non-core land parcels and redeploy capital for growth funding needs.” - M Murali, CMD of SPL

This strategic move reflects Shriram Properties' commitment to prudent financial management and its intent to enhance its growth in residential projects across its operational markets.
newTitle: Shriram Properties sells mall land in Chennai for ₹93 crore

title: Ashwin Sheth aims to launch over 10 housing projects in 2025, enter Bengaluru | Company Business News - Mint
2024 in review: From General Elections to Yen carry trade unwind — 5 key events that impacted stock market investors | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
2024 in Review: Key Events Impacting Stock Market Investors

Publication Date: 2024

Source: Live Mint

The year 2024 was marked by significant events that shaped the Indian stock market, with a notable rise in the first half followed by a decline in the latter half, culminating in a modest annual return of 9%.

  • 1. Lok Sabha Elections 2024

    The General Elections led to Narendra Modi's return as Prime Minister, causing a significant sell-off in the stock market, particularly after disappointing election results.

  • 2. Yen Carry Trade Unwinding

    The Bank of Japan's interest rate hike created volatility in global markets, negatively impacting investor sentiment.

  • 3. Weak Earnings Outcome

    Corporate India's performance deteriorated in the July-September quarter, resulting in significant losses in market indices.

  • 4. Middle-East Crisis

    Tensions escalated with missile launches by Iran, impacting investor confidence in the Indian stock market.

  • 5. US Elections Outcome

    Donald Trump's victory in the US led to a surge in the cryptocurrency market but further declines in Indian stock indices due to foreign outflows.

“The overall sentiment among investors turned negative as uncertainty regarding US economic conditions and Japanese monetary policy persisted, leading to heightened volatility and sharp losses.” - Satish Chandra Aluri

The events of 2024 illustrate the interconnectedness of global happenings and their significant impacts on the Indian stock market, providing investors with crucial lessons for the future.
newTitle: 2024 in Review: Key Events Impacting Stock Market Investors

title: Teen forced to endure 16-hr flight with stranger's toddler in her lap - The Times of India
summary:
Teen Endures 16-Hour Flight With Stranger's Toddler

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] | Source: [Source Not Provided]

A teenager faced an unusual and challenging situation during a long flight, having to care for a stranger's toddler sitting in her lap for 16 hours.

  • The incident highlights issues of passenger responsibility and comfort.
  • The girl had to manage the comfort of the child as well as her own throughout the extended flight.
  • This scenario raises questions about airline policies regarding children and seating arrangements.
“I never expected my flight to turn into a babysitting job.”

title: RBI introduces name lookup for RTGS and NEFT - CNBCTV18
summary:
RBI Introduces Name Lookup for RTGS and NEFT

Date & Source: March 2024, CNBC TV18

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has launched a new beneficiary bank account name verification feature for Real Time Gross Settlement (RTGS) and National Electronic Funds Transfer (NEFT) systems.

  1. Allows remitters to verify beneficiary's name before initiating a transaction.
  2. Reduces risk of errors and fraudulent transfers.
  3. Available through internet, mobile banking, and bank branches.
  4. Tasked to NPCI for development and implementation.

Key Benefits:

  • Enhanced transaction accuracy
  • Improved security
  • Streamlined payment processes
  • Reduced operational risks
  • Faster resolution of payment issues

Conclusion: The new feature strengthens security, accuracy, and efficiency of RTGS and NEFT transactions, promoting digital payment systems and minimizing potential risks.
newTitle: RBI's New Feature Enhances Security and Accuracy in RTGS and NEFT Transactions

summary:

Date: December 30, 2024
Source: News18 Hindi

As 2024 comes to a close, several key rule changes are set to take effect from January 1, 2025, impacting various sectors including LPG pricing and EPFO regulations.

  • Adjustments to LPG prices anticipated.
  • EPFO account holders will have new withdrawal options from ATMs.
  • UPI payment limits increased for feature phones.

title: Jefferies turns positive on HDFC Bank; reveals 22 stocks of its India long-only equity portfolio | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Jefferies turns positive on HDFC Bank; reveals 22 stocks of its India long-only equity portfolio

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Live Mint

Global brokerage firm Jefferies has brought back HDFC Bank to its Asia ex-Japan long-only portfolio, reducing stakes in several other banks.

  • Investment in HDFC Bank will have a 4% weighting in the portfolio.
  • Investments in Macrotech Developers, L&T, ICICI Bank, and Axis Bank reduced by 1% each.
  • New investment in Siemens initiated with a 4% weighting, funded by the removal of Samsung Electronics Pref.
  • Jefferies' India long-only equity portfolio includes 22 stocks across various sectors.
  • Projected 10% rise in Nifty 50 by the end of 2025, with a target of 26,000.
"At 20.5 times one-year forward PE, Nifty's valuation is nearly 6% above the past five-year average."

This reallocation reflects Jefferies' confidence in HDFC Bank while also balancing their portfolio across different sectors.

title: Samhi Hotels bets on converting old office buildings into luxury hotels | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Samhi Hotels Pioneers Office-to-Hotel Conversion

Date: November, Source: Company Business News

Samhi Hotels Ltd has initiated a unique project in Hyderabad, converting an empty office building into a 170-175 room luxury hotel under the W Hotel brand, managed by Marriott International. This is the first-of-its-kind initiative in the country, aiming to launch by FY27.

Gurugram-based Samhi Hotels, led by Ashish Jakhanwala, is bucking the trend of new constructions by repurposing existing office spaces, expediting the hotel development process.

  1. The converted office building will be transformed into a luxury hotel in Hitech City, Hyderabad.
  2. The hotel will be operated under the W Hotel brand, managed by Marriott International.
  3. The project is expected to be launched by FY27.
Ashish Jakhanwala, chairman, managing director, and CEO of Samhi Hotels Ltd, claimed that this will be the first-ever initiative of converting an office building into a hotel in the country.

This innovative approach by Samhi Hotels could set a precedent for the hospitality industry, streamlining the hotel development process and potentially reducing costs.
newTitle: Samhi Hotels Pioneers Office-to-Hotel Conversion

title: From costlier cars, GST updates to US visa fees: What’s all changing from January 1, 2025? - Upstox
summary:
Upcoming Changes in India: GST, Car Prices, Visas, and More from January 1, 2025

Date & Source: December 31, 2024, Economic Times

As the calendar turns to 2025, India is set to witness a range of changes in regulations and rules impacting businesses, consumers, and the economy. From higher car prices to stricter GST compliance, here's an overview of what's changing in the new year.

  • GST Compliance: Mandatory Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) will be required for accessing the GST portal, and E-Way Bill restrictions will be imposed to streamline logistics.
  • Car Prices: Major automakers are set to increase prices due to rising input costs and inflation.
  • Visa Processes: Thailand is expanding its e-visa system, and the US is introducing more flexible visa appointment rules and changes to the H-1B visa process.
  • Telecom Regulations: The government has updated Right of Way (RoW) rules to boost infrastructure development and simplify the process for telecom providers.
  • RBI Rules for Fixed Deposits: The Reserve Bank of India has introduced new guidelines for fixed deposits with NBFCs and HFCs, allowing premature withdrawals without interest for small deposits.
  • UPI Limit Extension: The transaction limit for UPI 123Pay users has been doubled, allowing feature phone users to make payments of up to ₹10,000 without an internet connection.
newTitle: Upcoming Changes in India: GST, Car Prices, Visas, and More from January 1, 2025

title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO opens tomorrow: GMP, price band, issue size among 10 key things to know | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO opens tomorrow: GMP, price band, issue size among 10 key things to know

Date: December 30, 2023

Source: Live Mint

Indo Farm Equipment's initial public offering (IPO) is set to open for public subscription on December 31 and will close on January 2. The company, which manufactures tractors and agricultural equipment, has a grey market premium (GMP) of ₹80 per share.

  • The IPO consists of a fresh issue of 86 lakh equity shares and an offer-for-sale of 35 lakh equity shares.
  • Price band is fixed at ₹204 to ₹215 per equity share.
  • The lot size for the IPO is 69 equity shares.
  • Proceeds will be used for debt repayment, expanding manufacturing capacity, and supporting its NBFC subsidiary.
  • The company aims to offer different portions of the net issue for various types of investors, with 50% to QIBs, 15% to NIIs, and 35% to retail investors.
“Indo Farm with traditional business value and experienced promoters is expected to capitalise over the long run,” said analysts at Anand Rathi.

The IPO is designed to strengthen the company's financial position and support future growth, making it a significant upcoming event in the stock market.
newTitle: Indo Farm Equipment IPO opens tomorrow: GMP, price band, issue size among 10 key things to know

title: New Bajaj Pulsar Motorcycle Teased; Could Be The RS 400 - NDTV
summary:
Bajaj Pulsar's New Teaser: RS 400 on the Horizon?

Published on: Date, Source: Source Name

Bajaj Auto recently released a teaser of a new Pulsar motorcycle, hinting at a performance-oriented model that could be an 'RS' variant. The audio clip suggests a single-cylinder engine, and it's speculated to be the 'RS 400', a supersport derivative of the NS400Z.

  1. The NS400Z has a 373 cc single-cylinder engine with 39.5 hp and 35 Nm of torque.
  2. The motorcycle comes with four ride modes and features like ride-by-wire, dual-channel ABS, and traction control.
  3. The new Pulsar, if it's the RS400, is expected to share similar power output and features, priced at a premium over the NS400Z.
  4. The reveal is anticipated at the Auto Expo in January 2025.
If it is the Pulsar RS400, then expect it to get similar power output and similar features as the NS400Z.

Stay tuned for more updates on this exciting development in the world of two-wheelers!
newTitle: Bajaj Pulsar's New Teaser: RS 400 on the Horizon?

title: Adani Enterprises to exit JV with Wilmar in first big move since US indictment - Hindustan Times
summary:
Adani Enterprises Exits Joint Venture with Wilmar in Significant Move After US Indictment

Date: Dec 30, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Adani Enterprises Limited (AEL) has announced its decision to exit its joint venture with Wilmar International, marking a significant transaction following the US indictment of the Adani Group.

  • AEL will divest its stake in Adani Wilmar Limited, raising over $2 billion.
  • The new agreement involves Lence Pte. Ltd acquiring a 31.06% equity share of AWL.
  • To meet public shareholding norms, AEL will also divest an additional 13% of its equity stake in AWL.
  • The total exit will leave AEL without a holding in AWL, completing a 44% divestment.
  • Proceeds will be directed towards growth in infrastructure sectors, including Energy, Transport, and Logistics.
“This transaction highlights Adani’s strategic focus on streamlining its portfolio and unlocking liquidity to invest in its core businesses,” Adani Enterprises statement.

This move is part of AEL's broader strategy to enhance its investment in key sectors and better serve its estimated 350 million consumers.
newTitle: Adani Enterprises Exits Joint Venture with Wilmar in Significant Move After US Indictment

title: Adani Enterprises to exit Adani Wilmar Ltd; AEL to raise over $2 billion - The Hindu
summary:
Adani Enterprises Exits Adani Wilmar Ltd and Raises Over $2 Billion

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Adani Enterprises has signed an agreement with Wilmar International to exit its joint venture with Adani Wilmar Ltd. This move will raise over $2 billion for AEL, through a combination of an OFS (Offer for Sale) and a direct sale to Wilmar.

  • Adani Enterprises is expected to use the proceeds to grow in the core infrastructure businesses.
  • The focus areas include Energy & Utility, Transport & Logistics, and adjacent businesses in Primary Industry.
  • The transaction is anticipated to be completed by March 31, 2025.
“The proceeds will be utilised for growth of AEL in the core infrastructure businesses.”

In conclusion, this strategic exit from Adani Wilmar signals AEL's commitment to strengthening its core operations and positioning for future growth.
newTitle: Adani Enterprises Exits Adani Wilmar Ltd and Raises Over $2 Billion

title: Top Gainers and Losers today on 30 December, 2024: Adani Enterprises, HCL Technologies, Hindalco Industries, Bharat Electronics among most active stocks; Check full list here | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:

summary:
Ex-Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai Criticizes IndiGo Over Tarmac Incident

Date: December 30, 2024, Source: News18

Former Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai expressed frustration over IndiGo’s treatment of passengers after being left waiting on a hot tarmac in Bengaluru without air conditioning.

  • Pai criticized the airline on social media after the incident.
  • Passengers were left on the tarmac before air conditioning was activated following protests.
  • He tagged civil aviation authorities in his social media post.
  • IndiGo responded thanking him for his feedback and assured improvements.

title: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu tells why he’s not worried about Indian talent migration, “Rising talent migration - The Times of India
summary:
Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu on Indian Talent Migration: Not a Symptom of Hopelessness

Date & Source: January 25, 2025, Times of India

Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu has a different perspective on the rising talent migration from India. He believes it's not a sign of desperation, but rather an indication of the global demand for Indian talent and skills.

  1. Vembu sees the migration as a positive outcome of India's education system and the global recognition of Indian talent.
  2. He argues that the migration is not due to lack of opportunities in India but because better opportunities exist elsewhere.
  3. Vembu also notes that many migrants eventually return to India, bringing back valuable experience and investment.
"Rising talent migration from India is not a symptom of hopelessness, it is an indicator of the global demand for Indian talent and skills." - Sridhar Vembu

In conclusion, Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu's perspective on Indian talent migration challenges the common narrative, highlighting the global demand for Indian skills and the potential benefits of this migration.
newTitle: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu on Indian Talent Migration: Not a Symptom of Hopelessness

title: Banks lead Indian shares lower as high US Treasury yields weigh - Reuters India
summary:
Banks lead Indian shares lower as high US Treasury yields weigh

Date: Dec 30, 2024 | Source: Reuters

India's benchmark indexes fell on Monday, led by bank stocks, as elevated U.S. Treasury yields and the prospect of fewer U.S. rate cuts continued to weigh on emerging markets.

  • The Nifty 50 fell 0.71% to close at 23,644.9.
  • The BSE Sensex lost 0.57% to settle at 78,248.13.
  • Ten of the 13 major sectors fell, with high-weight financials losing about 1%.
  • HDFC Bank and Reliance Industries, the heaviest weighted stocks in the benchmark indexes, lost about 1% each.
  • The smallcap index shed 0.6%, while the midcap index added 0.4%.
  • The Federal Reserve has projected a slower pace of rate cuts in 2025, boosting U.S. Treasury yields.
  • Foreign outflows intensified due to high yields and worries over elevated valuations.
  • JSW Energy rose 2.8% on a deal to buy renewable power company O2 Power Midco Holdings.
  • Adani Enterprises gained 7.6% after announcing its new airport in Navi Mumbai will be operational by May.
“The high yields have intensified foreign outflows, while worries over elevated valuations are also weighing on sentiment.” - Saurabh Jain, SMC Global Securities

The markets are reacting to the higher U.S. Treasury yields, leading to lower trading volumes and sentiment among investors.
newTitle: Banks lead Indian shares lower as high US Treasury yields weigh
